H0.text: They have very short wavelengths, which distinguishes electromagnetic waves from other types of waves.

H1.text: They transmit energy instead of matter is how electromagnetic waves differ from other waves.

H2.text: They can travel through a vacuum and through matter is how electromagnetic waves differ from other waves.

H3.text: They can change direction by reflection when they strike an object, which distinguishes electromagnetic waves from other waves.

A4.text: EMR or EMW is a self-propagating wave of the electromagnetic field that carries momentum and radiant energy through space.

A5.text: All forms of EMR travel at the speed of light in a vacuum.

A6.text: Electromagnetic radiation is produced by accelerating charged particles such as from the Sun and other celestial bodies or artificially generated for various applications.

A7.text: Plasma in certain layers of the ionosphere reflects some longer wavelengths of radio waves.
